properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential for more than 25 cm of snow by midnight Saturday night. A Pacific storm system will develop in the Gulf of Alaska and remain in place this weekend. Light snow developing on Friday will gradually intensify through the day on Saturday. An even stronger system is possible on Sunday. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-30T18:50:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-30T02:51:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0514058207.2020
Area: South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy snow likely beginning Friday night through Saturday. Heavy snow is forecast to develop Friday night near the Manitoba border before spreading eastward across most of far northern Ontario. At this point in time, forecast guidance suggests that 15 to 20 cm of new snowfall can be expected by the time the snow tapers off from west to east Saturday night. This heavy snow is associated with a strengthening low pressure system that is forecast to track across northern Ontario Saturday and Saturday night. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-30T12:01:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-29T20:02:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1267267987.2020
Area: Sachigo Lake - Bearskin Lake, Big Trout Lake - Kasabonika, Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake, Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake, Webequie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. A warm front ahead of an approaching Pacific low pressure system will spread snow at times heavy to the Williston region and Pine Pass this evening then to the BC Peace River region by midnight. Total snowfall accumulations will range from 15 to 25 cm for the Williston region and Pine Pass and 10 to 15 cm for the BC Peace River region. The snow is forecast to end Friday morning in Williston and by midday Friday for the BC Peace River. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-30T15:03:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-29T23:04:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4276797226.2020
Area: Highway 97 - Pine Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. A deepening low pressure system will move across the BC central coast later tonight. Heavy snow associated with this system has begun over many North Coast inland communities and is expected to continue until early Friday morning. Near Kitimat, precipitation will stay as a mix of wet snow and rain throughout the night with lesser snowfall accumulations expected. For areas north of Kitimat, snowfall amounts up to 20 cm are possible before the snow eases early Friday morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-30T18:08:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-30T02:09:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3250863726.2020
Area: North Coast - inland including Terrace, North Coast - inland including Kitimat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong northwest winds of 90 km/h tonight over exposed coastal sections. A strong low pressure system will cross the BC central coast tonight bringing very strong winds, especially to exposed coastal sections. Ahead of the low, southeast winds will range from 60 to 80 km/h. As the low makes landfall overnight, the winds will shift to northwest 50 to 70 km/h except up to 90 km/h sustained wind speeds over exposed coastal sections. Winds will slowly abate throughout Friday morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-30T15:02:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-29T23:03:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3602046325.2020
Area: Central Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long episode of heavy rain continues. A low pressure system is forecast to cross the central coast tonight. Another brief period of heavy rain will occur tonight as the low moves inland. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-30T13:59:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-29T23:02:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2337233441.2020
Area: Central Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong southwest winds gusting to 90 km/h overnight and early Friday morning. A deep low pressure system will make landfall over the central coast of BC tonight. Winds will rise to 70 km/h gusting to 90 overnight as the low moves into the central interior. Communities near and within the Coast Mountain Range will be the most likely to receive the severe winds tonight and early Friday morning. Winds will remain blustery on Friday but will lower to sub-warning criteria Friday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-30T15:03:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-29T23:04:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0420746174.2020
Area: Central Coast - inland sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm continues. A warm front associated with a Pacific low pressure system is producing snow over the Bulkley Valley and the Lakes District tonight. The snow will become heavy at times later this evening and then end by Friday morning as the storm system moves through. Total snowfall accumulations of 10 to 20 cm are expected. However, areas south of Burns Lake will see near 5 cm of snow before it changes to rain late this evening as warm air invades the area. The rain will change back to snow early Friday morning before ending later in the morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-30T15:05:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-29T23:06:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3747661878.2020
Area: Bulkley Valley, Lakes District
properties.Author: Environment Canada
